title: File:Northbound Thompson Drive, Museum of the North in background, University of Alaska Fairbanks campus.jpg
author: RadioKAOS
description: Otto W. Geist (1888-1963) left a considerable mark on what is now the University of Alaska Fairbanks during his association with the university in the middle 20th century. Despite coming from a mining background and lacking a terminal degree, his renown as an archaeologist and paleontologist rivaled that of more credentialed colleagues. Shown in this photo are two memorials. In the foreground is Geist Road, a major thoroughfare in the western suburbs of Fairbanks. Geist Road runs along the section line marking the southern edge of the UAF campus. In the background is the University of Alaska Museum of the North. Various buildings housing the museum over the decades have been formally known as the Otto W. Geist Building, including this one.
